text: When creating the email you can select the custom object from the personalisation tool and insert it into the email
Is this the drag and drop builder you’re using? Or classic editor, or custom coding?
A template in the drag and drop builder.

That unfortunately can’t be customized. There’s no setting/option and it’s not possible to edit the `<head>` for media queries. If you need more control over the width, the settings have that option for the classic editor, or you’ll need to code a template.
Got it! Thanks for the direction.--
And just to confirm, I've been able to add a mobile media query via CSS to adjust font and image sizes, but that's not an option to adjust the email body width?

I’m not sure where you’re adding the media query? There is no access to the `<head>` in the drag and drop editor, so anything added somehow would end up in the `<body>` and may not work across email inboxes properly. See the notes here: <https://www.caniemail.com/features/html-style/>
I'm new to HubSpot so thanks for your patience with me! You'll see I've added it over on the right side of this screenshot.
Oh, that’s not the drag and drop builder I’m referring to. That would be why. I thought you were using <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/email/create-marketing-emails-in-the-drag-and-drop-email-editor>
I’m not sure why you’re not able to target the width. Your best bet may to be to open the email in a window and inspect the code, and play with it there to see what you need to override.
That's what I've been trying. I've been attempting to target #contentTableInner or #contentTableouter without any luck.
There’s probably another wrapper or nested table that has a set width, or you need more specificity. I don’t know what else you could do, I don’t work with this editor at all for email.
